info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 17 at 4:53AM CDT until August 17 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
At 453 AM CDT, Trained weather spotters reported significant flash flooding in the warned area. At 4:30 AM, a car was reported stranded in flood waters in Joliet. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 1 inc are possible in portions of the warned area. Dangerous, potentially-life threatening flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Significant flash flooding.
SOURCE...Trained spotters.
IMPACT...Rapid-onset, significant flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, low-lying areas, and poor drainage areas. Widespread street and underpass flooding. Possible flooding of structures. Possible flooding of highways.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Aurora, Joliet, far southwest Naperville, Bolingbrook, Romeoville, Plainfield, Oswego, Lockport, Yorkville, Crest Hill, Montgomery, Shorewood, Sugar Grove, Boulder Hill, Fairmont, Rockdale, Crystal Lawns and Bristol.
info.instruction:
A Flash Flood Warning means rapid-onset flooding is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along creeks, drainage ditches, and other waterways should take immediate precautions to protect life and property.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL KANE, NORTHEASTERN KENDALL AND WEST CENTRAL WILL COUNTIES

area.areaDesc: Kane, IL; Kendall, IL; Will, IL
